_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE MID STATE FARMERS COOP INC. IS AN AGRICULTURAL RELATED RETAIL BUSINESS, WHICH PRIMARILY STORES GRAIN AND SELLS AGRICULTURAL INPUTS TO CROP PRODUCERS FOR CROP ENHANCEMENT.   OUR COMPANY STRIVES TO PROVIDE A SAFE WORKPLACE FOR OUR EMPLOYEES, FARMER OWNERS, CUSTOMERS AND THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH WE OPERATE.  THIS IS DEMONSTRATED BY THE FACT THAT IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS WE HAVE HAD NO REPORTABLES RELEASES THAT HAVE RESULTED IN A DEATH, INJURY, OR EVACUATION OF OUR FACILITIES OR ANY OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES OR EVACUATIONS OR SHELTERING IN PLACE.

OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT CONSISTS OF ONE 30,000 WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 131,000 POUNDS.    THE PLANT IS DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR FACILITY EACH YEAR AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL THEIR REQUESTS FOR IMPROVEMENT.

THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED ON A REGULAR BASIS IN THE SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND THE MAINTENANCE PRACTICE.  THEY ALWAYS USE GOGGLES AND WEAR THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS.  CLEAN SAFETY WATER IS ALWAYS PRESENT DURING THE AMMONIA OPERATION.

THIS COMPANY IS VERY AWARE OF THE COMMUNITIES RIGHT TO KNOW ACT AND WORK CLOSELY WITH OUR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT BY GIVING TOURS AND SAFETY TRAINING FOR LOCAL RESPONDERS.  OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS SHARED AND DISCUSSED WITH THE FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO BE OUR FIRST RESPONDER IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
